title: Vicky McClure on her beloved home city of Nottingham
text:
I probably first visited Wollaton Hall in Nottingham when I was in my mother’s womb –my mum and dad live about five minutes away from the park, right on its edge. It’s an Elizabethan country house and has been important to my family for ever; I have so many fond memories of it from when I was a child. There’s a famous stuffed gorilla, George, who lives in the Hall, among other taxidermy. I remember going in and having a right giggle because he was naked.

And now my fiancé Jonny [Owen, a producer and actor] and I have become really connected to the area, particularly after getting engaged last Christmas. It was Christmas morning when Jonny got down on one knee at home in Toton. I always make tea...
description: I probably first visited Wollaton Hall in Nottingham when I was in my mother’s womb –my mum and dad live about five minutes away from the park, right on its edge.
